data.text: @pjbhc I was inferring - apparently wrongly - that your preference for William over Charles meant that you only consider members of the Royal family eligible to be head of state at all & thus support the concept of hereditary monarchy. Apologies for my misunderstanding.

@sureed67 I've never mentioned the hereditary monarchy and if I support it or not. You've replied to me and started saying I can't say this/that and that I can/can't support this, that or the other. William has had a better connection with the public since his mother died/was killed.

@pjbhc If William jumps the queue because he’d be a better head of state, who’s to say that someone else wouldn’t be better still? If you believe in hereditary monarchy Charles should be king. If you don’t believe he should be king, you can’t support a hereditary monarchy.

@pjbhc No, you haven’t said William is next in line. And yes, Charles could abdicate in his favour. But if we think the direct heir to the throne would make a worse head of state than the next in line and should step aside, then the point of hereditary monarchy is weakened 1/2
@sureed67 My original tweet and any since have never said William was next in line. Charles could abdicate could he not?

@pjbhc But he’s not next in line to the throne. And if we buck the hereditary principle by a generation because we think William is better suited to the role of monarch, doesn’t it call the whole principle into question?
@sureed67 In my opinion, for the best of the country and for the better connection to the public. William, I believe has that connection across a wide range of ages.
@pjbhc And sorry if I offended too.
@pjbhc Sorry you feel that way. Can you then explain why he shouldn’t exercise his hereditary right to be king while his son should? Seriously want to understand.
@sureed67 You started off so well Susan and then just ruined yourself midtweet and turned into just another faceless account tweeting rubbish. Goodnight.

@pjbhc Nor is he going to step aside. Nor should he if we continue to have a hereditary monarchy. That’s how hereditary monarchy works. If you want to pick and choose a head of state you elect one rather than skipping a generation of the magic blood.
@sureed67 He's been waiting 66 years for his time to come, he's not going to do that.
@pjbhc He should put an end to the monarchy when the time comes.
